title.narrative: Afghanistan - Strengthening Health Activities for the Rural Poor (SHARP)

description.narrative: To support the Government in achieving the goal of the Health and Nutrition Sect or Strategy 2009-2013 to "contribute to improving the health and nutritional sta tus of the people of Afghanistan, with a greate focus on women and children and undeserved areas of the country".

condition.narrative: Amnual Program performance are carried out jointly with IDA and other development partners
The Co-financing Deadline for the effectiveness of the ARTF Co-financing Agreement is March 30, 2010
The Co-financing Deadline for the effectiveness of the JSDF Co-financing Agreement is March 30, 2010
The Cofinancing deadline for the effectiveness of the Results-Based Financing Trust Fund Co-financing Agreement is September 30,2009
The GCMU is fully staffed with a director, a procurement specialist, a financial management specialist and a Results BasedFinancing consultant.

title.narrative: People with access to a basic package of health, nutrition, or reproductive health services (number)

comment.narrative: 85% of the population has access to BPHS. The numerical value has been derived from an estimate of 5,496,300 population in 11 Bankfinanced provinces (as per CSO Afghanistan.
A target was not discussed with authorities during project preparation. The target presented here is based on the maintenance of a85% BPHS coverage throughout the project.

85% of the population has access to BPHS. The numerical value has been derived from an estimate of 5,496,300 populaiton in 11 Bankfinanced provinces (as per CSO Afghanistan). Update not available, likely to be available in October 2011

title.narrative: Pregnant women receiving antenatal care during a visit to a health provider (number)

comment.narrative: Based on 32% coverage (2006 Household Survey) and on a population estimate of 219,852 pregnant women (4% of the total populationinthe intervention area as per CSO statistics 2008-9). The baseline number pregnant women receiving ANC is 70,353
50% ANC coverage (based on an estimate of 238,255 pregnant women)

Based on 60% coverage (AMS 2010) and population estimate of 219,852 pregnant women (4% of the total population in theintervention area as per CSO statistics 2008-9). The total number of women receiving ANC is 131911.
DPT3 coverage was 34% in 2006. The numeric value (74750) is based on the estimated population in the provinces financed by the Bank.
60% is the 2013 target. The numeric value is based on the estimated population in the provinces financed by the Bank.
DPT3 coverage was 40.2% (MICS 2010/11). The numeric value (88380) is based on 4% of population in the intervention area as per CSOstatistics 2008-9).
Target in percentage and is expected to be greater than 90% by end of the project)

title.narrative: Number of consultations per person per year
Score on the balance scorecard examining quality of care in health facilities

comment.narrative: 2011/12 Balance Scorecard revised and updated and is not comparable with previous Scorecard.
